intro: Robiquetia amesiana, commonly known as the Ames's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and is often found in crevices or on slopes. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
